data.approach: Searching for bg-warning/20 text-warning and similar patterns to categorize which should use DaisyUI alerts vs intentional custom badges

summary: Searched dashboard for bg-{color}/N text-{color} patterns
All patterns are intentional: compact badges, hover states, section backgrounds
NO instances found that should be converted to DaisyUI alerts
data.approach: Comprehensive grep search followed by manual categorization of each usage type
reviewFocus: Confirm agreement that existing patterns are intentional
No code changes needed - this is an audit task

keyDecisions.decision: All bg-{color}/N text-{color} patterns are intentional
keyDecisions.rationale: They serve different purposes: compact inline badges, hover states, section styling - none are alert messages that would benefit from DaisyUI alert components

summary: Searched dashboard for bg-{color}/N text-{color} patterns
Categorized all patterns by usage type
Determined NO instances should be converted to DaisyUI alerts

quality.preExisting: This was an audit task - no code changes made

suggestedTasks.title: Document pseudo-alert pattern conventions in CLAUDE.md
suggestedTasks.description: Add section explaining when to use bg-{color}/N text-{color} patterns vs DaisyUI alert components. Include examples of appropriate uses: compact badges, hover states, section backgrounds.
suggestedTasks.reason: Would help future developers understand the intentional distinction

patterns: bg-{color}/N text-{color} is for compact inline badges (10-12px font)
DaisyUI alert components are for prominent user-facing messages
Hover states like hover:bg-success/20 are correct usage
gotchas: Signal cards use tiny badges (text-[10px]) - too small for alerts
EpicSwarmModal has color mappings for badges, not alerts
